Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; ENGRAVED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of Senkamanisken
Description: This shabti in faience, which comes from the royal necropolis of Nuri, belonged to the Nubian king Senkamanisken. He reigned over the kingdom of Napata at the end of the 7th century B.C. The statuette is distinguished by a dorsal pillar rising as far as the skull, inscribed with a part of Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead (compare with E.6103).
